channel.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
channel.description:
[youtube]http://youtu.be/873ktQ57AaI[/youtube]
As you can see, the problem is that item disappear as soon as the person open the door. Same happen with every gates and guild doors. How can this be fixed and where in the files it can be fixed?
Thanks lot,
Will happily reward your time and effort
-Bee

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“fran ta the brah, post:26, topic:459820”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=562723.msg4106299#msg4106299 date=1348016873]

cant see the youtube vid at work, which bug was this. the one where you go upstairs and down to see all ground items visually duplicated? or the one where spam clicking on piles leaves some items visually still there? (like seeing crap all over the wilderness)

No, when you walk through a door / gate and try to pick up an item, it dissapears and when you relogg it turn visual again.

I think it’s better to remove needsClear and fix the other bugs properly.

oh moparscape source… i was wondering why i had never seen this bug before.
[/quote]
this bug was on angel aswell just saying[/quote]
Yes. They are the same bug.

Read full topic

item.source: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

This whole setLocation vs teleport is fucking retarded.

There should only be setLocation, because teleport is only used when you’re actually casting a teleport spell. Where that is handled is the only acceptable place to have a teleport method, which should be private.

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Crooks, post:22, topic:459820”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=562723.msg4106291#msg4106291 date=1348016136]

the one where you go upstairs and down to see all ground items visually duplicated

Same concept. setLocation should resolve the issue?
[/quote]
Well, then we must use setLocation for all places such as Spellhandler , Scripts, Npcs, object actions, thieving etc etc, since all of them use teleport.

Also when you die it sends worldinfo and the items dissapear if you head back to pick up your items.[/quote]
Where’s the logic in that?
There’s nothing that uses teleport method when talking to npc, or when you pickpocket. or when you use spells. It’s only used when you actually move from location to another, ie. going through door or teleporting to another area.

None of which you described actually use teleport method. Except for teleporting but that’s how its supposed to be.

I just think that the whole fix is shit and the person who made it didn’t clearly think it through properly.

You can either use setLocation in places you don’t want to clear items and want to move the character, or you can do it properly.

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:19, topic:459820”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=562723.msg4106212#msg4106212 date=1348010322]
the one where you go upstairs and down to see all ground items visually duplicated
[/quote]

Same concept. setLocation should resolve the issue?[/quote]
Well, then we must use setLocation for all places such as Spellhandler , Scripts, Npcs, object actions, thieving etc etc, since all of them use teleport.

Also when you die it sends worldinfo and the items dissapear if you head back to pick up your items.

Read full topic
item.source: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:19, topic:459820”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=562723.msg4106212#msg4106212 date=1348010322]
the one where you go upstairs and down to see all ground items visually duplicated
[/quote]

Same concept. setLocation should resolve the issue?[/quote]
Yes, it should.

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:16, topic:459820”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=562723.msg4106036#msg4106036 date=1347998109]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=562723.msg4106014#msg4106014 date=1347995440]

public void teleport(int x, int y, boolean bubble) { Mob opponent = super.getOpponent(); if (inCombat()) { resetCombat(CombatState.ERROR); } if (opponent != null) { opponent.resetCombat(CombatState.ERROR); } for (Object o : getWatchedPlayers().getAllEntities()) { Player p = ((Player) o); if (bubble) { p.getActionSender().sendTeleBubble(getX(), getY(), false); } p.removeWatchedPlayer(this); } if (bubble) { actionSender.sendTeleBubble(getX(), getY(), false); } setLocation(Point.location(x, y), true); resetPath(); -> actionSender.sendWorldInfo(); }

When opening gates and doors you get teleported… And teleport method sends WorldInfo and like Nothing says the clientsided fix for item dupe bug clears the ground items.
[/quote]So, can’t you just recalculate the items in view and send them?

I’ve tried to fix it that way, but the old items are still in the memory, you need something to clear the items when leaving the area.
The fix which is in mpc-client would work if it would use setLocation instead of teleport, or, you could make a new packet that clears the ground items when you want to clear them.

I’m not really sure how it’s on real RSC, I haven’t really investigated it further.

@Crooks:
Why do you always repeat what I say? It gets quite annoying.
[/quote]I don’t see why clearing everything, then recalculating and sending it wouldn’t work…[/quote]
That’s pretty much what I meant.

Read full topic

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:15, topic:459820"][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=562723.msg4106014#msg4106014 date=1347995440]

public void teleport(int x, int y, boolean bubble) { Mob opponent = super.getOpponent(); if (inCombat()) { resetCombat(CombatState.ERROR); } if (opponent != null) { opponent.resetCombat(CombatState.ERROR); } for (Object o : getWatchedPlayers().getAllEntities()) { Player p = ((Player) o); if (bubble) { p.getActionSender().sendTeleBubble(getX(), getY(), false); } p.removeWatchedPlayer(this); } if (bubble) { actionSender.sendTeleBubble(getX(), getY(), false); } setLocation(Point.location(x, y), true); resetPath(); -> actionSender.sendWorldInfo(); }

When opening gates and doors you get teleported… And teleport method sends WorldInfo and like Nothing says the clientsided fix for item dupe bug clears the ground items.
[/quote]So, can’t you just recalculate the items in view and send them?

I’ve tried to fix it that way, but the old items are still in the memory, you need something to clear the items when leaving the area.
The fix which is in mpc-client would work if it would use setLocation instead of teleport, or, you could make a new packet that clears the ground items when you want to clear them.

I’m not really sure how it’s on real RSC, I haven’t really investigated it further.

@Crooks:
Why do you always repeat what I say? It gets quite annoying.[/quote]I don’t see why clearing everything, then recalculating and sending it wouldn’t work…

Read full topic

When opening gates and doors you get teleported… And teleport method sends WorldInfo and like Nothing says the clientsided fix for item dupe bug clears the ground items.

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

It’s because world info is sent when opening doors for some reason(It isn’t really needed). Which in mopar classic, clears all the ground items.

It’s some shitty fix for clientside item dupe bug.

            if(packetID == 131) {
                loadArea = true;
                serverIndex = DataOperations.getShort(packetData, 1);
                wildX = DataOperations.getShort(packetData, 3);
                wildY = DataOperations.getShort(packetData, 5);
                layerIndex = DataOperations.getShort(packetData, 7);
                layerModifier = DataOperations.getShort(packetData, 9);
                wildY -= layerIndex * layerModifier;
                --> needsClear = true; <--
                hasWorldInfo = true;
                return;
            }
            if(packetID == 109) {
                if(needsClear) {
                    for(int i = 0; i < groundItemID.length; i++) {
                        groundItemX[i] = -1;
                        groundItemY[i] = -1;
                        groundItemID[i] = -1;
                        groundItemObjectVar[i] = -1;
                    }
                    groundItemCount = 0;
                    needsClear = false;
                }
...
...
...
...

Read full topic

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“veer, post:7, topic:459820”]Is it a server-side issue? Why don’t you track what communications occur?[/quote]Honestly, I’m not entirely sure…

Picking up an item doesn’t seem to do trigger sending any information to the client. And the removal seems to be done properly (by inspection of the code, not actual testing). So, it should be sending the correct information to the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @Kevin21 Kevin2
item.description:
@Kevin21 wrote:

veer:

Is it a server-side issue? Why don’t you track what communications occur?

What is strange is that it do not appear to be a server side issue. I thought it could be a client side issues but … Never saw that before so it make me really confuse bout the situation. First time dealing with this and it make me clueless. In fact, when you relog like Crooks said , item re appears , but its a real problem when people will PK and try to loot items mean while and open gates @ dragon or anything like this. As soon as the person click gate. items disappear, person have to relog to loot items which is a major problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @Kevin21 Kevin2
item.description:
@Kevin21 wrote:

[quote=“Crooks, post:4, topic:459820”]CFF told me it’s a graphical glitch, if you relog the items will appear as normal again.
One negative thing though. To log out of the wilderness if you are going to loot stuffs. For example, the gate of the dragon maze.
Very difficult to relog and pick up under 60 seconds if there are a lot of PK ongoing.[/quote]

Yes, found out bout that part but it does not really help my problem that i need to fix this bug. Thanks for help tho. Have a nice day !

Seems like i asked a good question ! Wondering if someone will be able to fix this!

Read full topic

item.title: Calling all pro coder for a moparscape source bug (Rewarding help)
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

CFF told me it’s a graphical glitch, if you relog the items will appear as normal again.
One negative thing though. To log out of the wilderness if you are going to loot stuffs. For example, the gate of the dragon maze.
Very difficult to relog and pick up under 60 seconds if there are a lot of PK ongoing.

Read full topic
